Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay in well furnished apartment”
Reviews.Author: teohl
Reviews.Content: For its central location and nearby to traffic, the apartment was very quiet and far removed from noise. The decor was fine and it was clean...very important. Housekeeping staff were courteous and efficient , working around us with no fuss at all. Great. Needless to ay, the view over the bay to the Harbour Bridge is awesome and sitting on the balcony enjoying the late afternoon breeze is an added plus. As for food, numerous eateries in the Star complex and the nearby Darling Harbour and Harbourside gives more than enough choices to satisfy one's tastes

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment, Great Location, Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: maryags
Reviews.Content: Our family spent two nights in a two bedroom apartment in the Astral Residences and it was fantastic. The beds were comfortable and the kitchen and living areas conducive to relaxation for our two teens and us. Some discerning guests might notice the sofwallowed a bit worn, but it was ok for us. We also had laundry facilities which helped on the last days of the holiday. We had an easy walk to Darling Harbour attractions, Chinatown and the CBD. Although we were a bit worried about the apartment being part of the casino complex (we are not into gambling or nightlife), it was fine. It was quiet. Many restaurant choices and prices available on site and nearby. Service was great - prompt, polite and sincere attempts to help - for all aspects of guest needs. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An Exceptional Hotel Experience - Even for the Jaded Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: DMMatlin
Reviews.Content: It's hard to impress someone that does more than 100 nights a year in hotels, but the Astral managed to do just that. Exceptional front office staff... tick Fast and easy check in process... tick Proactive offer of a restaurant booking as it's a busy tonight... tick Great signage to actual room... tick Bags quickly bought up from car dropped at valet... tick Proactive suggestion of a bar to get an after work relaxing drink... tick Exceptionally quiet room...tick, tick, tick Exceptionally well laid out room... tick Fine stylish furniture... tick Very comfortable bed...tick Very clean room...tick Great bathroom...tick Not sure exactly what star rating this property has, but it is easily 5 star in my opinion. This is an exceptional property that ticks many of the boxes you want when staying somewhere for busy business trip. A challenge I've always had in Sydney is finding a good hotel on the city fringe so that I can get a hire car in and out without the hassle of the CBD. This is that property! Add the great rooms, add the restaurants, add the service and this is hard to beat in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Love Star City Apartments!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle22103
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Star City Apartments many times. Love the location, love the views. Staff are very friendly. Rooms are a great size and very clean and welcoming. Next time i am in Sydney i will stay at the Darling as I have heard it is pretty spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade...nice!”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at Star City (it's old name) before so was familiar with the location. Having a conference in Darling Harour I decided to return to The Star as it is close and an easy walk from the Sydney Convention Centre. On check in, I was told my standard room (booked via Qantas for $199 a night!!) had been upgraded to a Residences Apartment Suite, which was lovely. I only wish I'd been travelling with other people as the room was huge with a full kitchen, dining, lounge, two bedrooms, two bathrooms, laundrette and a walk in robe as well as a balcony... So rediculously large for one person!! Staff were friendly. Check out was at 11am and a late check out request got me an extra 30 minutes (I had asked for midday). The only down-side was the room smelt of paint - having been freshly refurbished. A shame as it gave a bit of a headache, but not enough to complain. I'd most certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: Room was average for 5 Star, perhaps 4 star. I was not informed of the ppol closure until I went up to the gym for a swim and was told we had to go to the public pools complimentry. I thought we could of at least been able to use one of the other Casion hotels. The worist part was the constant drilling above our room every morning due to construction. The worst part was the fact we simply were not told of about all this.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Feb for 5 nights and they were fab. Excellent location next to Darling Harbour, we had a balcony room looking out over the harbour and a side view of the Harbour Bridge. They have all you need - washing machine, tumble drier, fully fitted kitchen.Within walking distance of Darling Harbour, aquarium etc. Was a shame the pool was out of bounds during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Neither excellent or bad”
Reviews.Author: Aussiegirlonthemove
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astral Tower (Hotel is part of the Star Casino complex) for the weekend while visiting friends in Sydney. Pros - The location is excellent with only a short 10-15 minute walk accross the footbridge to the Sydney centre (shops etc). As its part of the Casino complex there is ATM's, resturants & bars aswell as tourist information all easily available & the Staff are friendly and helpfull. Cons - pool was closed and apparently is going to be closed for the next 12 months. Room service menu in the room was the old menu (which had changed over a month ago) and a new one had to be brought up which then was half the size of the previous. Food quality was ok but very small portions. Housekeeping didnt get to the room untill 5 and we had to wait around for them to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: dreamsaremadeofthis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 nights in a 3 bedroom apartment. Nice view of Darling Harbour alongside cranes & construction. Rooms were clean & well appointed, however had booked for 2 adults & 4 kids but only had 4 towels. Like others, discovered that pool was temporarily unavailable only when we asked to use it.Given the number of comments about this, would have thought it would now be something that customers were informed about at time of booking. In our case was a major drawcard to have a pool given we had 4 children with us. As we left we were informed that we could have used the Ian Thorpe pool by showing our room key. Shame they didn't tell us this earlier. My only other complaint was the lack of free wi-fi. Surely in a 5 Star hotel, free wi-fi is a given. Have stayed all over the world & this just makes Australia look like a backwater. However overall, had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Imadog
Reviews.Content: We booked into Astral for a few days of enjoying our city as tourists and spend time by the pool. Unbeknownst by us, especially because the reservation agent neglected to tell us, the pool is closed and will be for another 2 years. Unfortunately, we were unable to find another room in the city suitable otherwise we would have checked out immediately. The kids were extremely bored, and spent the days goggle eyed in front of the Foxtel. I guess they only want gamblers there.

Reviews.Title: “Back for one more go”
Reviews.Author: soo_what
Reviews.Content: After my last stay I said I would never go back but I thought Id give The Star one more chance. After the disappoint of the last stay I booked into the cheaper of the 2 bedroom apartments going for a Pyrmont view room so I wasn't expecting much this time I just needed a place to stay for one night but to my surprise this time the room was fine the noisy construction had finished some construction could be heard around 8am In what I think is the Darling. I wish someone could explain to me how they work out these rooms last time I booked a "City View" at a more expensive price then the Pyrmont room, but my view consisted of the construction site and the back of the lyric theatre no said "city view". Were as this time booking a Pyrmont room I was given what appeared to be more of a city view room. If I was to stay here again Id like to know Im getting Value for money If I was to book the more expensive room. The Star in itself is more finished with more choices besides room service, hopefully once everything is finished at The Star it will be a really good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room OK, service could be a little better”
Reviews.Author: maud_cyril
Reviews.Content: Huge room and comfy bed although a little hard for my liking. Pillow menu which is a nice touch. Servicing of the room was a bit shabby, nothing replaced even though it was obvious we had used all the tea (maybe they just didn't check). Stayed 3 nights and ended up leaving little notes around the room e.g please replenish the teabags etc. Glad we didn't stay another night otherwise we would have been out of soap. A la carte breakfast served quickly and was good value for the money. Didn't have the buffet breakfast. Staff very friendly especially concierge and front desk. Shame the pool is still out of service. I would have thought that guests should be offered the use of the pool at the Darling as its next door and from what I gathered owned by the same people but that wasn't allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel room and service”
Reviews.Author: margsch
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night here, the room and bathroom were very clean, bed comfortable. When I checked in was told I had been upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment which was a "smoking" apartment, I requested to be given a nonsmoking room in the Hotel, I probably should have mentioned this when checking in.. My room was quiet but I did notice construction work happening at the back of the Hotel. Breakfast in the 80Bistro was fresh and large variety of fruits, Danish pastries, breads, cheese, cold meat etc to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star Quality, just 5 Star price”
Reviews.Author: Petros14
Reviews.Content: Just finished 3 nights in a " harbour view" should be called " harbour glimpse" through the construction and poles. They won't advise you they are doing a major re-construction, thar includes the pool you can't use. When we approached them at the desk to see if we could make some approach to see what we can do to amend things and perhaps, if all facilities can't be used, can we look at price adjustment. Our reply from customer service was they gave us a " Feedback form to complete". Another thing to consider before booking, they are proud of the 5 new restaurants available, sadly only 2 are open. Might be worth asking when you book. For the 3 days our room was never cleaned, just new towels and made the bed with the same sheets for the duration. No vacuuming or emptying the two bins. We had 3 people in our room and everyday it was set up for two people. The daily saga was getting another cup, towel, etc. The computer didn't forget to bill us for 3 people for breakfast etc, that system works well. We are regular travellers to Asia due the value you get, this is our first holiday in Australia for a while, back to Asia it will be for us. The Star was $429 a night, I would stay in the centre of the city, you end up eating at Darling Harbour anyway. For that price we were woken at 0730am to jack hammers and workers outside, fair enough they have to make improvements, but be honest with clients it is happening and offer a better price. We are sure not to get any feedback from the hotel on our concerns, but if I could give some advice before you book, check the construction dates. Really just stay away from the hotel to be honest

Reviews.Title: “Construction site noisy poor staff horrible food.”
Reviews.Author: soo_what
Reviews.Content: STAY AWAY! Noisy, city View 2 bedroom apartment is now looking straight over a construction site, with work starting at 7am on at Saturday morning after being told that construction had all but finished. Thank God only stayed one night would have been a more peaceful sleep staying at central station, with loud arguments in hallways, levels above throwing empty bottles down with the lovely smashing sound at around 2am, Where is the Security? The room Service food is highly over priced for the quality of the food. None of our request were met, for a near empty apartment a higher floor away from the lift is not much to ask for the price you are paying when it has very little else to offer.I will not be staying here again much better value for money in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Star City Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: Sue_Coupe
Reviews.Content: It was our 1st wedding anniversary and I booked a "Harbour View Room" ($560 per night room only) 3 months in advance. I made particular mention of the special reason we had decided to stay at Star City and that we had dinner reservations. When we were shown to our room we were so disappointed - a small, dark room with no Harbour View, only a "Construction Site View" complete with workers using the portable toilets. Of course we asked to be moved to another room, only to find a similar dingy room with an even worse view. We were not advised at anytime after booking that construction was being undertaken. The Manager offered the second room at half price along with a bottle of sparkling wine. Before deciding I made some calls and found that most of the city was booked out that weekend. We had no choice but to stay at Star City - something we will never do again!!

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in Sydney, Australia”
Reviews.Author: neerajslg
Reviews.Content: star city , sidney is one of the best place to stay in Sydney. due to its close proximity to most happening area darling harbor where tourist love to spend time. some attraction at darling harbor are imex 4D theater , jafran Indian restaurant, small train ride for children. Star city is a casino hotel, a paradise for casino lovers with multy cuisine restaurants and vibrant atmosphere to indulge inn. The staff at hotel are very courteous, they always have answer to all your needs. i love this hotel, and always stay at star city whenever i visit Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good Food, Great Accommodation and first Class entertainment at Lyric”
Reviews.Author: kalyngra
Reviews.Content: Visited the Complex to see Dr Zhivago. Spent 3 lovely days at Star City. Pool was very nice early in the morning for a few laps. The seafood and asian dinners of an evening were first rate. The standard of our accommodation was spacious, nice view, well appointed and was very clean. Breakfasts were excellent everyday with a wide variety to meet the needs of anyone. The Sports bar also has great snack meals and with all of the screens most sports are able to be viewed in comfort. The light rail stops at Star City. If a Senior, after purchasing the daily $2.50 ferry rail ticket., The light rail will allow you to travel at no extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in handy location”
Reviews.Author: griswalds59
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Star City Casino and usually stay in one of their apartments. Travelling with our adult sons we were upgraded to a 3 bedroom apartment. The apartments are very spacious and can comfortably sleep 6 people. The rooms were clean although the lounge room needs upgrading as the lounge and one chair provided were very old. The Casino is undergoing major renovation and I'm sure once complete Star City will again be on our list to revisit. The staff are polite and well trained and always happpy to help out. One piece of advice stay away from the Buffet - we have tried it twice and both times sub-standard. The restaurants are a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: chrissylee
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner September 2010 for my 21st Birthday and on arrival got a free upgrade to the Star Suite. The room was more than spacious with fantastic facilities. Could not ask for anything further, Would definately recommend it to friends, family, and strangers! Beds were so comfortable we wanted to take it home with us!

Reviews.Title: “when the services are good it is indeed good”
Reviews.Author: shassall
Reviews.Content: Best to check the room given to you before you accept the keys - non-smoking rooms not always non-smoking and the housekeeping does not even bother to rid the stench before the next lot checks in. Otherwise, when its is good is it is indeed good.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: eve16
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located at the casino, with tram access to the city, although casino & hotel were under construction at the time. Rooms were not as clean as I expected - we found dirty bandaid on the floor when we entered the room!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, no real complaints!”
Reviews.Author: 13b
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding with our baby. I had my own portacot. Worst is the shower over the bath!! Good sized rooms. Great staff. Good room service food.

Reviews.Title: “Casino - Don't change money at the window cage”
Reviews.Author: vdulip
Reviews.Content: On two occasions I changed US$300 and got Australian $268.50. I think this is a big rip-off. Change money outside the casino and you will get a better rate by almost $30.

Reviews.Title: “Good but will be better when it's finished”
Reviews.Author: vodkatonicsunshine
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Star City in a 2 bedroom apartment in July 2011. The hotel is undergoing major renovations so it's sometimes a bit hard to get around the hotel (you have to go in and out doors and up and down stairs instead of taking a direct route). Despite that, it's a good hotel with great facilities. Our room was very quiet and we didn't hear any noise from builders at all. The beds are huge and comfortable. The apartment is very spacious with everything you'd need. The pool area looked terrific, although it closed for renovations the day we arrived. They didn't tell us it would be closed for the duration of our trip which was a shame as it was one of our reasons for choosing this hotel. We were offered complimentary entry to the public pool nearby but it's not that convenient. The breakfasts were fantastic. A great array of delicious sweet and savoury things. The booking system for the breakfast is quite cumbersome and they tried to charge us full price instead of the discount they'd offered us on booking. All was cleared up in the end. The staff handled it well. The staff are excellent throughout the hotel. Very helpful and friendly and prompt service. Once the renovations are completed I'd certainly stay there again. It is a great location and very convenient to town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel on Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: VAS27
Reviews.Content: It's a very good and luxurious Five Star hotel very centrally located near Darling Harbour. The venue is very good and walkable from Darling Harbour. The hotel has very good & big casino. Rooms are spacious and well designed. Room service and breakfast is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: BeenThere101
Reviews.Content: Iv stayed here quite alot, my last stay was pleasent however if your thinking of having a party in the apartments think again! They are so strict and will kick you out with ease! Or if there is too many ppl in the room they will make you book another room or kick everyone out! Overall a good hotel and casino is awesome lots of restaurants and bars to choose from really good location!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Huge Place. Good Value”
Reviews.Author: cs_macewan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed apartment, and found it roomy, clean and perfect for our needs. We had a lovely view from our balcony. The Place is huge though and a very busy casino. We ate in the buffet which was ok. Good location for Sydney, but is a little away from the main tourist areas of the city. Near Darling Harbour, which was very busy in the evenings. A nice place to sit and have a drink in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “A.M.A.Z.I.N.G.”
Reviews.Author: peanut012
Reviews.Content: First time in sydney, meeting friend with her parents on day 2, so had a single room first night, family suite for a week then twin for few days. all rooms fab. fantastic food, service, casino, little shop, great spa. so close to darling harbour ferry. one tip- ask for room near lift as walk to rooms can be far. reception very knowledgeable and understanding. they can also cash your trav.chq, make phone calls on your behalf, etc. true 5* service at 3* cost.

Reviews.Title: “A TRUE RESORT IN THE HEART OF SYDNEY”
Reviews.Author: Bambini08
Reviews.Content: This is my first review of star city, my family and I have been staying here a couple of times a year for 6 years. And saying that I have no complaints. We keep returning to this hotel, because it is resort style and very child friendly. The main activity we do at the hotel is use the pool, first of all the pool is on a rooftop with breathtaking views of Sydney Harbour, the pool is quite large with 2 hot tubs, and even on its bussiest days there is room for everyone, the staff here at the pool are the friendliest hotel staff I have ever come across and this has not changed in our 6 years of visits. The rooms are kept very clean, this visit (April) we stayed in an apartment for a week, It was so nice to have our own rooms with the use of a kitchen and laundry, I highly recommend this for families. The hotel is under a bit of renovations right now, but this has not stopped the great service. We cannot wait for the new reasturants to open to give visitors more variety as there are only 3 reasturants available on the property now. But Darling Harbour is not a far walk if you want to eat out. We live an hour and a half's drive out of Sydney, but we always come here if we need a break and are not travelling overseas as it feels very first class and as far as im concerned the only hotel in Sydney which feels like a resort. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking for r & r in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: Peripotetic
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for those wanting to go to the Casino downstairs, darling harbour or the local area (Fishmarkets etc). It has reasonably sized rooms which are comfortable with good views of Sydney. However, the service is extremely mediocre! You will all think I am exaggerating here, but it took over 1 hour for my bags to arrive in my room! Nup, no hyperbole here at all. I checked in at 12:45, my bags arrived just before 2pm. The reason was apparently "we are short staffed", which I usually translate to "we have bad managers". I didn't use the internet but I think this is another one of those ridiculous hotels which charge for internet usage- why are they not charging for water and electricity usage as well? Perhaps an oxygen charge too. Internet is standard now guys, wake up. Its a convenient place if you need to be in this area of Sydney, but don't expect service here.

Reviews.Title: “Large and Stylish rooms”
Reviews.Author: MyJoy76
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in a harbour view room when I travelled to Sydney for work. Harbour view was nice but it had limited visibility of the Harbour bridge. So, I don't think it was worth the extra pay. The room was up to date and had a modern and elegant theme throughout. The variety of pillows and a soft bed was a bonus. Huge LCD TV without Foxtel channels was a bit dissapointing. The bathroom was very small. The hotel lifts were slow and had to wait for a while to get on one. The information pamphlets provided in the room was inadequate. Would have loved to see at least a map showing where the hotel is located. But thanks to my GPS. The location was nice and close to my work and Darling Harbour was ony 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and amazing view of the harbour bridge from my bed.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley080389
Reviews.Content: Staff were amazing. Extremely attentive and willing to I above and beyond. While not in the perfect location this means you can have a great view from the room that other more central hotels can't compete with. It is also less than a ten min walk to central Sydney. I stay in Sydney every week for work and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Low expectations well exceeded.”
Reviews.Author: HeathAS
Reviews.Content: Booked two apartments side by side to have a dozen friends stay the night for our farewell/party. We also had guests stay in the rooms up to 11pm as their policy allows. There is a no-party policy for the rooms and you are limited to the amount of alcohol you take up so we had to smuggle a truckful of booze in our luggages and kept our music & chatting to a minimum. Security came to respectfully quieten us down later on so we went out to the casino floor. We had a couple acquaintances show up in what they thought was nice attire for a casino but security wouldn't let them in saying it was because they were intoxicated which obviously wasn't the real reason. As much as I should of been upset I was actually glad they weren't let in as they arrived looking like dags. Anyway... The rooms were great! The staff were great! The food was great! I knew overall it could of still been better for the money spent but we still enjoyed our night immensely! The major downfall is their policy to make guests clean after themselves: dishes, benches, floors, walls, tiles, carpets. Otherwise they charge you additionally! Luckily we'd kept the place in great condition anyway but you're paying for an expected service & for the money we payed we shouldnt be doing the maids job.

Reviews.Title: “very handy in wet weather”
Reviews.Author: gauy
Reviews.Content: We're a family of four that travelled to Sydney for a long weekend away. We stayed here for its location to the fish market and close proximity to Darling Harbour - not to mention late night entertainment if you wanted it. There's a Coles supermarket just across the street if you needed any everyday things. We stayed in the city view room and the view was fabulous- even saw the Harbour Bridge! Renovations were occurring but we did not hear a sound - though I'm not sure how much actually went on as it was raining for three out of the four days we were there. Rooms were clean and spacious though there was still a hint of smoke in the room (we were on a non-smoking floor too). Beds were wonderfully firm and comfy and they even had a pillow menu for you. There were numerous restaurants located throughout the casino complex which came in handy those nights when it poured. There was a great variety of food at the garden buffet. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Maritime_Historian
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, with large rooms and all the perks you'd expect from a 5-Star hotel. Check in was pleasant and with a smile. Location is an easy walk to Darling Harbour. Also very close to the Star City Casino which is in the same complex.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing, don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: fil310
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star rating I was very disappointed with the quality, service and location. I think the person who gave this place a 5 star rating should find another job. We booked a deluxe room few months prior, on arrival we were given an apartment in the towers. The room had a musty smell and the carpet dirty. Weren't notified that breakfast was finishing at 10am on checkin. Went down to breakfast and find out that breakfast was finishing in 10 mins. Quite a few couples arrived after us which were disappointed also. The casino is of poor standards. Limited to what you can purchase to eat, sports bar available only, very limited choice of poor quality food and poor service. The location is near the fish market, you don't want to be outside too long, the smell wants to make you dry reach. As for security don't leave your bags unlocked in rooms. People can't read DO NOT DISTURB on the door. Come to Perth, our Burswood Casino is a true 5 star!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a small group in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: snake11
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a three-bedroomed apartment, which was ideal for the six of us and worked out to be excellent value for such a popular destination. It had all the amenities of self-catering, with the service of a hotel. The larger apartments are situated in the hotel so that there are good vies of the bridge and business district from the balcony. The pool and gym were quiet and well kept. The staff were excellent both before and during the trip. The only drawback was the current building work, which statrs at 7am. If you're a light sleeper avoid for what the staff estimate to be another year.

Reviews.Title: “Star Suite - nice luxury option for a different kind of mini break...”
Reviews.Author: KAG1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 11 Feb for an early Valentine's Day treat. We live and work in Sydney. Purchased through WOTIF ($500 for one night in a Star Suite) as an Escape Package - breakfast, late check-out and bubbly/strawberries on arrival. The good: Great room - Star Suite cost quite a bit (!) but was very roomy, had a great luxe look and feel, 3 TV's, amazing couch, lovely bath, nice view of harbour and a few little glitzy touches to make it feel like a proper upmarket 'casino' stay - a la Las Vegas (colour lights in bed headboard, TV in bathroom and amazing mini bar area). Plenty to do - great location to city/harbour attractions, big casino complex including Lyric Theatre - not as nice as Crown but something different and fun. We don't even know how to gamble but had fun in the casino atmosphere. Service - very friendly and professional staff. From housekeeping to room service to casino and front desk - all staff were very helpful, open and friendly yet professional. No attitude or arrogance as found in some large hotels. A plus! Breakfast - elegant and vast continental breakfast (hot food costs extra) in Sean's Kitchen. Pool area - whilst not exactly 5 star - the Turbine's health club was great and not crowded, Great view from the pool. The not so good: The price! The most expensive one night we have paid for in Australia! We were meant to recieve champagne and strawberries on arrival as part of the package and we recieved a bottle of low end white wine and a small bowl of cherries - these things matter when it is a Valentine's Day stay! Range of bath products was a bit minimal considering the amazing bath/bathroom/suite. No specific bath salt or bubble bath offered. Porter and valet staff were very helpful but clearly run off their feet. Delays were experienced. I think for the price - one hot option should have been included with breakfast. If we could get a very good price - we would stay in a Star Suite again - we loved the room and it was a fun stay - however for the same price - I would be tempted to try the Hyatt or Shangri-la next time as it was not 'unforgettable'.

Reviews.Title: “Good comfortable stay, location and apartment size not the best”
Reviews.Author: max_d1
Reviews.Content: We paid a bomb to stay here during New Year 2011 in a 2 bedroom apartment. The apartment was nice enough with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, a smallish living room and a semi-open kitchen and a small balcony. Attached to the casino hotel which has few restaurant and night club options. 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour which was somewhat handy. Having the apartment as a part of a 5* hotel is a big plus for daily housekeeping, very competent concierge, restaurants, security, etc. If you are in Sydney to be at the centre of attractions, harbour, etc., the location is quite off though.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: rorster316
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights staying at one of the two bedroom serviced apartments. Flew over from Perth with friends visiting us from the UK. Cannot say enough positive things abou the experience. As we had come through on red eye, we requested an early check in and despite a fully booked hote, were granted check in at 10am. Rooms were immaculate, serviced well every day, very quickly and discreetly. The only negative abou the room was that our TV wasn't HD, not a big complaint really. All staff, from concierge to reception to doormen, were all incredibly warm, friendly and helpful. We had a silly security scare, accidentally left hotel room door open. When we called reception, hotel manager and security were at our room door in 3 minutes. All the food and drink, at casino bars and restaurants, as well as from room service, were very reasonably priced for an upmarket facility. The gym, pool and spa were great, amazing view of the city skyline from pool and hot tub. All casino staff were brilliant. Honestly could not recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: xdominogirlx
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend in one of the 2 bedroom apartments which we found through the Entertainment book. The hotel is a short walk to the harbour where we found wonderful restaurants and bars. We had thoroughly excellent service from all staff (apart from one porter when I was leaving, and my feedback in regard to this was responded to very quickly, which I am grateful for). Although I did not explore the facilities of the hotel, I can comment on the buffet breakfast which was delicious and again where I received excellent service. Our room itself was fabulous, very comfortable, clean spacious and excellently fitted out. During our stay the hotel was undergoing significant renovation work, and I was most impressed that this did not disrupt me at all- I'm not sure if maybe there's some amazing Double Glazing going on, but I barely heard it! Well done Star City!

Reviews.Title: “We had a good weekend”
Reviews.Author: Glas166
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend mainly for a show that was on, and had a great time. The double room had plenty of space, facilities were excellent. The Gym and pool were excellent as were the views. We did not eat at the hotel, as we dined while in the city or on morning walkabouts. Location was good for Darling Harbour and close to the Ferry terminal. The staff were pleasant, well trained and very correct. We did not go to the casino, which appeared very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: HHTeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 2 nights with wife and 2 teenage sons in a 2-bedroom serviced apartment. Very clean and roomy. Fantastic kitchenette with all the utensils, cutlery and clothes washing machine and dryer. Coles Supermarket and Liquorland is nearby so we could buy food and drinks and cook in the kitchenette. Value for money. Will definitely stay here again if back in Sydney. One problem - waited 1 hour for our luggage to be delivered. After 1 hour, called the receptionist and she said will be sent immediately. After another half hour, decided to get it ourselves and found them still in the driveway. Apart from this episode, fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “big dissapointment”
Reviews.Content: we stayed at star city hotel for 2 nights in nov with family(4adults+1child 4yr old). we were so looking forward to stay there since we saw the hotel from ferry on our honeymoon 7yrs ago. we heard the hotel was good and everything fantastic. dissapointment started from when we arrived by shattle, noone helped us luggage, my husband used cart and did as porter. we checked in 2 bedroom room + single extra bed for my son, as we requested, when we got the room, we saw 1 queen+1 king single(unbelievably small for 2) and no extra bed and no extra towel and etc... we asked room change but no other room available, and they would charge from us for extra bed that we already requested! we also requested late check-out for late night flight but room was full booked and we needed to get out from room. none of request thru, would charge extra bed that we already organised thru agent. I never reccomend anyone the hotel and I never stay there again. however, one of concierge was so stand out with beautiful service and 3 house keeping staffs were so kind and care about our needs.

Reviews.Title: “classy”
Reviews.Author: jaramati
Reviews.Content: great place to stay for a great night out with spouse or friends or group. classy, elegant and 5 star all round. room service was overpiced but thats what youd expect in a 5 star casino hotel, other than that everything great :). parking was a really good price though at only 26 a night i think it was.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: KnutFlo
Reviews.Content: Very noisy hotel. Expensive food, try cafes and restaurants in the area instead.

Reviews.Title: “Wasted money”
Reviews.Author: TrondheimVagabond
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely overpriced. Just average room. Pool is too small and crowded for a hotel of this size. Breakfast is expensive and not really pleasant location (called "garden buffet" but is inside and more like a cheap cafeteria at the mall). Internet is very expensive. Elevators are too few and you have too wait long for one to appear, the reason is that because of under-capaity is has top stop at many floors. The bar at top floor is almost never open and when open obviously just for special events where you are not invited. I had room at the floor under it and it was annoying having this very loud music and at the same time not even having the possiblity to use it. My advice is clear, choose another hotel in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth Five Stars.”
Reviews.Author: vickie2010_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through our airmiles, and on arrival as we were a honeymoon couple we were upgraded to a harbour view room. You could just see the harbour bridge, but not a spectacularly great view. I found it quite stuffy in the room as no windows would open, which I understand the reasons for, being on a high floor, but some fresh air is much needed in the heat. Air con worked fine though. Staff really friendly and helpful, and service was always quick, polite and efficient. I do not think this hotel is 5 stars though, the bathroom resembled one you would find in a cheap hotel in Benidorm, definitely needed an upgrade and the communal areas, like lifts and corridors were dull and dirty. Bed was lovely, the room equally nice, but again no Wow factor. Great location though, a short walk to Darling Harbour which we loved. We did spend a few hours in the Casino which was fun, but cheesy as expected. Best thing about this place is the buffet breakfast, loads of selection and all really fresh. Pool area nice too, but nothing special. I think there are nicer hotels in Sydney for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The Star City Suite is AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: bbbg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for an anniversary at the Star City Suite: it was simply divine, and could not have been any more perfect! The suite is very, very roomy - with a dining room, a lounge area, huge flatscreen TV and a rather large and luxurious mini bar. The views from the suite are beautifully expansive, and reach from the harbour and Harbour Bridge, across to the city skyline. The bedroom was amazing. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the mood lighting around the headboard was a lovely touch (you could change it to various different colours - talk about attention to detail!). Another large flatscreen TV greeted us in the bedroom, and there was yet another TV above the lovely spa bath in the bathroom (complete with a waterproof remote control!). The bathroom was just beautiful too (and very large), with no area spared from luxury. The suite was a little expensive, but it is definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Should have lowered my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: BexSta_000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a business trip. 3 nights in a standard room. I was quite looking forward to staying here, as i figured it would be a fairly nice hotel considering the Casino hotel here in Melbourne. Yup. Wrong. Rooms were dated and stuffy (no opening windows). Made worse for me as my airconditioner didn't work properly. Woke me up at about 3am on the first night putting out a horrible racket, so I had to switch it off to get some sleep. This made the room incredibly stuffy. Horrible. Didn't get fixed until the afternoon of the 3rd day - and the repair guys came in to fix it while I was in the room trying to work. Some other negs: Room service was not remotely reliable. Especially breakfast. I couldn't rely on it being delivered to my room on time, so after a couple of attempts I gave up and went out. Room wasn't clean - just basic things like sticky table/bench tops and dirty seats. The only positives were the concierge and the gym.

Reviews.Title: “Star Suites...awesome. Normal rooms average.”
Reviews.Author: Kyliedbu
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here in two room types...the Star Suite and the Delux room. Firstly, the Star Suite was well worth the little extra. Amazing room! Huge and luxurious. Only bad thing about this room is you don't get your own private balcony as all the rooms share the same long balcony. Even if there was a few sun beds or chairs on the balcony it would be lovely. The Delux room was just plain and boring. A bit dated in parts but really average and not worth the money. Things I liked about the hotel....the buffet breakfast was the BEST EVER HAD! Prebook this with your room for only $20 per person. The front desk staff were lovely and really went above and beyond. The pool area was brilliant. We were also given an early checkin and late checkout. Things I didnt like about it....the lifts stop at the Casino level so they are always really busy and sssllllooow. Alot of larikans from the casino around too. Porters were slow with our bags but everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “WHO GAVE THIS ESTABLISHMENT 5 STARS?”
Reviews.Author: Rater1981
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is quite nice but you pay for it. Our first time so we stayed in an apartment which had 2 separate bedrooms, a living space and kitchen facilities. The room was large but not very clean (compared to the price of the hotel room). We went to look at the view from our balcony and I stepped on glass strewn over the tiles, we contacted housekeeping who came up and half heartedly looked for and cleaned up remainder of glass! Cleanliness was not up to standards at all with the remains of someones breakfast still on the brekkie counter and food streaks were visible, bathroom contained hairs and mould was visible on bathroom tiles!! Seriously, with the price of the rooms, you do expect a certain standard, but alas, this has not been maintained by Star City Hotel and Casino, beautiful landmark when she opened, but now just another monstrosity blocking the view of our gorgeous harbour! We will not be back and recommend Rydges and Quest apartments which outshine above establishment!

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: ACTTraveller2009
Reviews.Content: We travel to Sydney several times a year. Star City has become our favorite places to stay. Great location, close to shops,markets,restaurants,light rail and monorail. Comfortable clean rooms. Good range of restaurants. Shows and gambling. Lovely staff. Lovely pool and spa.

Reviews.Title: “A good base for business trips”
Reviews.Author: AMH007
Reviews.Content: As a part of a conference i was booked into a Delux Pyrmont room, however I wasnâ€™t overly impressed for what I expected to be a more â€œsuperiorâ€� room, however was clean and well appointed. Breakfast in the garden buffet was more like a canteen or cafeteria at the local shopping centre that said the food served its purpose and there was plenty of it. If you want to get out for a nite to eat thereâ€™s plenty of great places to eat just down the road at Darling Harbour, although I preferred Bartino restaurant and bar just up the road from Star City, a nice quiet place, good food and just a gentle stroll back to the hotel. At the end of the day when your purpose is a business trip this is a central place that easily accesses most of the city and is good for using as a base on a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Complaints for the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neal055
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sadly lacking romms with blocked plumbing and dont dare complian.. stayed the asked for a newspaper. not received so the second night after complaining after eventually getting after lunch for the morning paper. Yep next day no paper.. next time i stayed there the shower drain was blocked and water ran all over the bedroom carpet. Told the front desk...Did they care....no did they thank me for reporting no.......... ooh ok sir did you use anything from the mini bar..??? haahhahaah I received a promotion for stay at the casin through the mail.....the afternoon i received rang up to book and yes .........all booked out two days ago...mmmm before it was even posted to us............ Sta city..... mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm The hotel is becomming a joke....... and they want to charge more 300.00 a night you have to be kidding......i pay 100 and stay at the pub.

Reviews.Title: “Too much noise”
Reviews.Author: Ciao68
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Star City several times but was extremely disappointed with the no knowledge of the construction work happening when making this booking we paid nearly $300 a night and over $400 for the Saturday on Sunday there was no work being done but on the other days we were annoyed with the sound of jack hammers a and other construction work. If I had known this I would of have booked another property. I understand that there is work to be done but not and that rate and they should make it aware that there is construction work happening when booking. Other that that the rooms are lovely we did stay in a 2 bedroom apartment which was clean and well maintained. I do enjoy staying at Star City but will no do so until the construction work is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: JesskaTwo
Reviews.Content: I booked a 2 bedroom Prymont View apartment on a Friday night as had a function to attend in Darling Harbour. Beautiful room, nice view. Kitchen was equipped well. My only issue is the bathroom wasn't as big as expected. There is a decent walk between reception and the apartments elevator. Plently of taxis available to take people wherever, we stayed while there was construction going on so there wasnt as many food options as last time I was there but there were still many. Overall, I would stay again but I would be keen to see what the hotel rooms are like - especially the Star Suite.

Reviews.Title: “Beutiful great facilities, staff very friendly and would come back again.”
Reviews.Author: DEJA1
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom apartment. 2 bathrooms and lots of space perfect for our family.. A short walk to restaurants in Darling Harbour. Pool and Spa was great but had to access them from outside with a cross wind most times. Would have been better if you didn't have to freeze when exiting the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartments!”
Reviews.Author: MDBird
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2-bdrm/2-bath apartment spending $300/night. Gorgeous room with W/D and full kitchen! Helpful staff & great casino. Anna in spa gives a great facial! Sean's Kitchen and Tapas have great food (try the risotto!)... Only downfall --> Bit of a trek if you are trying to get to Opera House/Harbour Bridge area and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate Apartments”
Reviews.Author: muirmuir
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a Star City serviced apartment for 3 nights as part of a work commitment at the Convention and Exhibition Centre. Our apartment had 2 bedrooms , 2 bathrooms, a kitchen, living area and balcony. Dining table/ironing board/hairdryers etc were all included. All of these were meticulously clean, fully equipped and enjoyable to use. The bathrooms were both surprisingly spacious and nicely decorated, which was a welcome break to the standard hotel bathroom white. The living area was spacious with a large plasma TV and the kitchen was modern and user friendly. Beds were very comfortable and rooms ambient. Star City itself is a ridiculously overblown, glitzy place, but incredibly fun whilst poking fun at itself. The glass rooftop bar (small but gorgeous) is an absolute treat day or night, with gorgeous views over the city and a sophisticated, ambient atmosphere. There are all manner of bars throughout the complex, but this one is classy and truly an experience within itself. The location close to Darling Harbour is great also and there are many shops and restaurants nearby, including a pancake restaurant which I hear is very popular. I loved staying at Star City, and would happily stay here agin in my leisure time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience....”
Reviews.Author: JustKDQ
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. It started with valet taking care of our car, check-in was a breeze and in the room within 20 minutes. Our one night stay was a great experience, catching the tram, gambling, dining - what more can I say. I totally would recommend the Star Suite - very comfortable, everything you need and a fabulous view to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Girls Weekend as always”
Reviews.Author: DianeSunnyCoast
Reviews.Content: This will be the 4th year we have travelled from Queensland and stayed at Star City for our Girlfriendsâ€™ holidays - we are definite return customers forever! Sydney and Darling Harbour are magnificent tourist destinations. Residing at Star City opens up a variety of holiday activities such as dining extensively at all the surrounding restaurants, shopping until we drop in Sydney, visiting the casino for a bit of fun, catching some fab theatre shows as well as music concerts such as the amazing Guy Sebastian at State Theatre. The apartments are such wonderful value for money when shared between a group of people wanting to experience Sydney! In all the time we have stayed at Star City, the level of service and value for money has been excellent. It starts with: Lovely greeting from our arriving shuttle/taxi from porters taking our baggage and awaiting our check in and room allocation Polite reception staff processing our booking for check in Excellent Apple bowl at reception with the best apples to crunch on to pick me up and elevate those low sugar levels because of travelling all day to get to Star City. Excellent apartment all round! Very clean in every way and the housekeeping staff â€“ well nothing was too much to ask of them! The concierge staff were always very accommodating â€“ booking shuttles, taxis and assisting with tourist destinations we were interested in. I am a Star City fan â€“ and the City views from apartments and rooms are breathtaking! Thank you. Diane

Reviews.Title: “My 1st 5 star experience l: (”
Reviews.Author: dspunkid
Reviews.Content: Over night stay for a romantics day & night for our anniversary We stayed for 1 night in a guest room, view was office buildings Bed board, lamps & table had dust which looked like it had been there for a while. Window does not open so it does feel stuffy Service at front desk is shocking We are not happy with our stay at Star city, I feel like we have been riped off for the amount of money we payed, we expected 5 star service, room & experience they just did not hit the mark for us, over priced & over rated. I have stayed at many hotels, Star city was my first 5 star experience & I have received better service & value for money at 3-4 star hotels

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Sydney, comes with a price, but its worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia1326
Reviews.Content: Star City is the only hotel in Sydney which has a casino. Although I'm not a fan of gambling, it was an eye-opener touring around the jackpot machines, the snooker tables etc. The casino was about the size of 2 football fields and have plenty of restaurants with a variety of cuisine, such as Asian cuisine, very suitable for my rather traditional Chinese grandmother. In addition, the buffet breakfast was wholesome and all of us stuffed our face every morning with the gorgeous amounts of fruits, bread, and Asian and Western selections. The staff was friendly and helpful, maintaing discipline in a hotel in the least imposing way possible. The rooms were spectacular. They had splendid views of the Sydney Harbour, and were immaculately clean. Room service was done impeccably and the chambermaids were courteous and honest. Beds were luxurious with fluffy pillows and warm blankets. I stayed in an apartment with 2 other family members and we felt it was like a home for us. I could live there, and even have a Golden Retriever running about. The location was awesome as well, located near the Sydney harbour with fantastic lightings, pubs, restaurants and tourist locations such as the zoo. In addition, transport was convenient, because the tram was only located at the basement, the tram takes us to Central Station where many trains lead us to different parts of the city. The hotel was also located near Chinatown which was quite boring and had distasteful and oily food, I also loved the gym facilities at Star City, and the gym instructors were amicable and cheerful. The pool was small but the jacuzzis were great with hot water. My only grudge was the lap pool's water being too cold for me, as it was nearing autumn and winter. The rooms definitely do not come cheap, and the convenient store has got rather snobbish helpers, who cannot seem to be bothered about you other than charging your items. But the store has got many Australian snacks such as Tim Tam, and stock up loads of ammenities that everyone may need to use. All in all, Star City is an amazing hotel, one that I would not hesitate to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “OK but probably not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Dobbie66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days with my husband while visiting Sydney. Location is the best part of the hotel - and also the proximity of the casino, theatre etc if that's what you want... stayed first night in a Pyrmont view room - to be honest a bit depressing so worth spending extra for the water views... rubbish bins hadn't been emptied in our first room so wasn't exactly endearing to us from the start... also found the reception / bell boy staff we encountered were all a bit 'up themselves' and not what I would call welcoming - just a bit too much attitude going on for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous apartment”
Reviews.Author: Swissie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-bedroom deluxe piermont view apartment. The main difference between an ordinary 2 bedroom apartment was that this one had two single beds in the second bedroom - especially good with teenagers! The apartment was spacious, clean, serviced daily. Well worth the money especially when you get a package deal that includes breakfast and parking. The only downside was that the main bedroom faced the building site next door (literally a couple metres away) and the worker started at 7am. But I guess that can't be helped!

Reviews.Title: “Not a gambler and this place was great.”
Reviews.Author: illucid
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment over night on a Saturday. It was fantastic. The room was great, clean. The balcony is luxurious - pity it rained so we could barely use it. We spent some time gambling, which was fun. We ate at the buffett - dinner was okay (I wouldn't particularly rate it), but the buffet breakfast was fantastic and delicious! I really liked the cafe in the hotel lobby. It was cozy and comforting for a late night snack. The hotel staff were always pleasant and friendly. I enjoyed the guys at the entrance to the apartments greeting me every time I went past. At the end of the day, this place is pricey but they do deliver on services and the rooms are nice. I'd definitely come back for a special occasion. I forgot my jacket in the room, and the hotel kindly had it sent to me 300kms away POA. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Not a gambler, but..”
Reviews.Author: AGeorgeofSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartments of Star City for one night on the weekend. What a great apartment. Large, 2 televisions, stereo, 2 bathrooms. One problem - we only stayed one night and had to check out by 11 am. I have stayed in the hotel before but we had our 5 year old with us this time and the apartment is just great. Also we love the pool - nothing like a hot spa outside when its cold and windy! We did not even get a chance to go to the Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed In Apartments”
Reviews.Author: 3ofusAuckland
Reviews.Content: Just to let you know we booked to stay here in a 2 bed apartment for 4 nights. Had a phone call before leaving home to say that I had to leave the apartment on Tuesday between 8am - 3pm because the place was having a complete shutdown. I wasn't happy about not being told before booking and certainly not happy about leaving at 8am so I phoned the manager, she apologised and said that I should have been told and looked after me with the same room rate for a Sat night. I ended up only staying two nights and left and stayed somewhere else. Star city are doing extensive building and renovations all over but we were lucky they didn't affect us. The Manager looked after us and was honest explaining the situation. We would stay there again because the apartments are one of the best in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: trabug
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel near Darling Harbour, clean, spacious and well looked after.

Reviews.Title: “ITS A AWESOME HOTEL TO BE A GUEST OF STAR CITY CASiNO”
Reviews.Author: Inderjit_1980
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for three days ...continuing are honeymoon from gold coast ... Its has a wounderful Entrance with open air Escalaters with fountains . We were checked in ten minutes upon our arrival and the best was that we got our room upgraded foc and also got a 20 $ casino coupon . The room was pretty big fitted with Lcd and the city view was amazing .. To go to the entrance we always have to cross Casino where we used to get free drinks and eatable as inhouse guests . The tram station is right in the basement of the hotel which makes the connectivity to city very easy ...overall it was gr8 staying in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Casino - Shame about the hotel....”
Reviews.Author: peteski9
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel, just not great either. We were staying in the apartment side of the casino rather than the hotel rooms. Old decor, walking down the hallways remind me of being back in the 80's! that needs updating quick smart! Room was spacious although you'd expect it to be for $600 a night. Very handy if you're there to gamble - pretty central location to the city if you're there to do the touristy things.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury apartment with everthing you need”
Reviews.Author: Ginnymic
Reviews.Content: Before booking into Star City, I researched every place in or reasonably close to Darling Harbour, where my husband was attending a conference. I chose to stay in an apartment rather than a standard hotel room as I prefer the extra room and the ability to prepare a light breakfast & snacks. Star City delivered so much more. We had a "Studio Apartment", no upgrade as other lucky reviewers have scored. Luckily the bedroom was placed in such a way that it was totally private. We were very happy with the extensive floor space, generous balcony (no furniture, maybe for child safety). As well as view of Sydney harbour, city skyline, the Harbour Bridge, the Maritime Museum, parklands and wharf areas, our apartment had everything we needed including a huge, fully equipped granite kitchen, full laundry, dining suite and a comfy lounge. The very comfortable king size bed with had quality linen, stacks of pillows, a large wardrobe with internal lights that activated when doors were slid open. There were plenty of drawers, cupboards & shelves in every room. Towels were ultra large and thick. Unlike other apartments which are not serviced during your stay, or only every four days, these were cleaned and serviced every day. Any request was met quickly and efficiently. All staff at Star City are obviously chosen carefully and trained well; combining friendliness with quick service, even the burly â€œsecurityâ€� checking patrons at the base of the escalator to the gaming floors. Although part of the Star City Casino complex, the apartments are accessed through a separate entry of the main thoroughfare â€“ you donâ€™t need to share lifts with the many, many people who seemed to stream into the casino floors all day and night. Renovation and construction work was going on during our stay, but we heard nothing. In case this all sounds too good to be likely, I had a few gripes, which I didnâ€™t complain about at the time â€“ they are very trivial and more than offset by the good aspects. One was that the kitchen was supplied with only two of each item of crockery and cutlery, obviously to discourage â€œextraâ€� non-paying guests. The television was not digital, and the extra channels were mainly paid movies ($16.95 per view), sports and hotel promotions. Not important most of the time, but a bit limited. The fairly grotty level below the main complex floor houses a station for Sydneyâ€™s Light Rail (called a tram, but looks like train to me) which for a fairly hefty fare takes you to various places including Central Station and the lovely suburb of Glebe (visit Glebebooks & Sonoma CafÃ©). It took perseverance to find this & the bus station, as signs are obscure, and it is easy to lose your sense of direction in the curves and corridors. Finding the shortest route to the nearby ferry terminal was also a challenge. Please note this was not due to directions from the Concierge â€“ I was going it alone. Star City seems to have numerous cafes & restaurants, only one of which (Seans) we tried. The food here is exceptional. Again, finding it was a chore, as I was advised to go through The Poker Room to access it. This I did, with my young & attractive daughter, while a poker tournament was on â€“ all men, all seemingly able to play & perve at the same time. The main stairway got us out with less scrutiny. I enjoyed my four night stay very much, and would live here if I could â€“ I would just bring my own TV, plates & cutlery. Anyone who complains about the standards must live in a palace somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Wow, Wow!”
Reviews.Author: lilfreshman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom apartment overlooking the city and darling harbour. it was the most amazing view and had a great location- easy acsess to darling harbour, monorail, shops, restaurants, buses etc. the apartment was very modern and spacious. Pool was great and not too cold. Starcity is having alot of renarvations that should be finished in about a year, but it didn't disterb our stay - apart from some restaurants being closed.The staff were amazing very helpful and polite. overall we absolutley loved starcity and if we were going back to sydney wound not look any where else to stay. would recomend to anyone looking for accomadation with real wow factor

Reviews.Title: “Very Lavish...not really a party hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TylerB1
Reviews.Content: Better for upper class folks that want to stay somewhere classy and feel classy. Not the best for a group of twenty -something military guys.

Reviews.Title: “Mamma Mia Experience”
Reviews.Author: Karenstravels
Reviews.Content: We choose Star City for our girls weekend as it was very convenient for Mamma Mia. We booked the basic Pyrmont room direct with the hotel and upon check in we were surprised to see that we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom apartment. The room was huge with 2 bathroom which was great with two girls getting ready to go out. We had a great view of the city sky line and the Harbour Bridge from our balcony. Thanks Star City for a very special weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: broke1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night before Australia Day, tried to get a 2 bedroom apartment but none available. Asked for two rooms to be close to each other or at least on same floor. We were placed side by side which was great. One room had late check out, bottle wine & free gift. The bottle of wine & free gift had to be asked for, and I am sure the reception did not believe me when I said I hadn't received them after I had checked the room. Breakfast in the Garden Restaurant was lovely, hardly anyone around and food very good, although one customer received something in his meal he was not happy about. Transport to the airport was arranged very quickly and with a smile which was nice. Shuttle trip was great got to see some of Sydney, was prompt on time. Rooms were fine, not 5 star though. Spa was not working, very disappointed with that. Gym & pool were great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: mrsgoofy
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bedroom apartment which was fantastic. Check in smooth all staff very courteous. The pool was great. There is construction as the hotel is being extended but the rooms were sound proof and only heard any noise if the sliding door or window was opened. Can't wait for the upgrades would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vaibhav81
Reviews.Content: The location is great, you cant go wrong. The casino at the ground level is also nice. The restaurants round the bridge are awesome. Overall rooms are nice and spacious, great tv. Check in is efficient and staff is courteous. Overall a great stay and would recommend for all families and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in the suits”
Reviews.Author: klausiau
Reviews.Content: We rented the suits and where absolutely surprised about the layout. We had a two bedroom suit and our experience we one of the nicest in our holiday. Very clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay but have to do double check the account”
Reviews.Author: tm1983
Reviews.Content: I arrived here at 11am and was told my room wasnt ready, which was fine as check in wasnt until 3pm. Left my bags and headed for a quick look around Sydney. Hotel promised to call when my room was ready. Received a call at 12.30 to say the room was ready. Headed back and checked in, they upgraded me to a 2 bedroom apartment. Apartment was fantastic, very clean and a nice size. Very big fridge, so i bought drinks and food so i wouldnt have to purchase from the minibar. The apartment was very cool, which was great at it was 35degrees outside. Got changed and headed back out pretty much straight away. Got back that night and realized my IPod was low on battery, reception offered to charge it for me and dropped it back to my apartment. Needed to use the internet, while i expected a charge for wireless, i didnt expect a charge for using the internet on the computers in their business centre. was something like $6.95 for 5minutes. Cant believe they charge for this. Ordered some chips and they were cold and didnt taste to good, the $8 charge i expected but i didnt know anything about a $6 delivery charge which i disputed and that was cleared off the account. Also noticed a $24 Transportation charge, which when i queried was for valet parking.... hmmmm quite funny when i caught the light rail. They cleared this off also. While very easy to get to from Central station, its a little out of the way and a lot of renovations going on. The few staff i dealt with were nice enough. While i would stay here again it would have to be because i got a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “We have a great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Allaka
Reviews.Content: A friend and I travelled from North West NSW to attend a function with our two teenage daughters. We stayed in a two Bedroom apartment and this was great value for money sharing between two families. They allow us to have an early check-in, so the four of us had lunch in the bistro. In the evening, our daughters attended their function after having their hair done in the hairdressers attached to the comlex. My friend and I had a lovely quiet meal in the Chinese Resturant and then a dabble on the tables for an hour or so.. All under one roof... May not suit people with little children, but we had a wow of a time..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, fab apartment.”
Reviews.Author: HollyJane
Reviews.Content: A lot of research was done for our trip to Sydney and this came up as a good place to stay. We booked a 2 bedroomed apartment, which was excellent value for money for our 4 nights stay. Upon arrival the staff were helpful and friendly. We had a query and it was dealt with promptly. The apartment was spacious, very clean and well kittted out, including a washing machine and tumble dryer, and hair dryers in the bathroom. We were aware of the building work, although it did not affect us in any way, our apartment did not look out onto the work, and we certainly did not hear it from the apartment. There is a vast amount of building work going on, with the hugest of holes being dug!!! There is a small shop on site, a Subway, a couple of other bars and places to eat on site, but it was only a good 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour, with plenty of restaurants. I would certainly stay in the apartments again, as it was value for money with the four of us. JANE

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: hiphiphorray
Reviews.Content: I travelled interstate to meet up with my sister for a weekend in Sydney. As we had both lived in Sydney for many years we were looking forward to returning for a weekend of leisure and pleasure. As we had tickets to see Mama Mia we decided to stay 2 nights at Star City as we remembered it was quite flash. We met at the front reception and were quite impressed with the decor etc. We went up to our room on the 11th floor and were instantly dissapointed when we opened the room door. The decor was very plain, and tired looking. The headboards had finger prints and smudges all over them. The view was looking over Pyrmont and ugly rooftops. I rang reception and enquired about a Harbour View room and was told that would be an upgrade which i was happy to pay, i was then told there was not a single room available with a Harbour View. As we both drink a lot of tea (BTW i take spare T.bags everywhere with me and my husband said "Hey it is a 5* Hotel i am sure they can afford T.Bags" i discovered we had x 2 English Breakfast T.bags so we asked at the reception for T.bags and the receptionist could give me 1, and said she would send some up to our room, we were sent another x 2 T.bags. ?? 5* i don't know?? We ordered the "complimentary" newspaper for both mornings and we did not recieve it both mornings.We thought we could spend the evening in the Star City complex and no need to venture into the city. Well we were wrong there, the complex is undergoing renovations (which should have been done 10 yrs ago) and there were no cafes at the front of the complex, no escillators taking you up to the cafes, just an ugly steel staircase at the side crowded with people coming and going and smokers. Needless to say we did not spend much time in the complex as the only other choice was , Subway, the Irish pub, or the Sports Bar which was not what we wanted on a Friday afternoon/evening. After Mama Mia on the Sat night we decided to go to the Casino. We did not know it was under renovations and not very nice at all. We wanted to sit and chat and have a couple of drinks and we walked around the gambling area and behind a huge curtained off area until we found a new bar area ?? a sports bar as it had a huge screen in a small theatre set up. We found a seat but there was a DJ playing doof doof music so loud we could not hear ourselves shouting??? As we spent most of our time in the Rocks and Circular Quay we will stay in that area next time and give Star City a big miss.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Room. Friendly Staff. Great View”
Reviews.Author: mikestar70
Reviews.Content: Booked a good deal for a room at Star City thru Wotif and was lucky enough to be upgraded to a Star Suite on arrival,. The room was very spacious and well appointed. Huge bathroom included a spa-bath and television. Great view of City skyline and Harbour Bridge from the balcony. Beware.. The city side of the complex is undergoing major renovations at the monent so there is some noise from 7am... But nothing too disruptive.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: msdcairns
Reviews.Content: Went to Star City to see ABBA show Mamma Mia. Wow! a great hotel but just seemed to lack service. No 'free' paper in the morning, ordered bubbly sent ot the room at 6pm - didn't arrive until after seven. Great views and weel decked out hotel but is not a patcu on Crown on Melbourne. Don't know that we would stay there again at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pity about the service.”
Reviews.Author: IC72
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic, a short walk to the Darling Harbour precinct which is full of entertainment and dining options. Ferry services are about 5 mins walk away. Staff at reception, porters & valet parking services are excellent. Comfortable and spacious 2 bedroom apartment was perfect for a family of 5. Great swimming pool area. Housekeeping services were poor - it took 3 phone calls & 3 hours to get the pre-booked baby cot brought to the room, a request for additional sugar for morning coffee went completely unactioned. We were then incorrectly charged for 2 cars (an extra $52), which had to be corrected on checkout. Service was definitely not worthy of the 5 star rating (and price). I would recommend this hotel to friends for its location and facilities only, but would warn them about the service.

Reviews.Title: “Sensational Star City!”
Reviews.Author: Mad_Travel_Girl
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Star City for the night after a wedding we were attending at Darling Harbour. We arrived in the valet parking area and we were prompted greeted by the staff and directed to the hotel lobby for check in. We were greeted warmly by the staff in the lobby who advised us that we had been upgraded to a suite, which sounded lovely. We were put in the Neptune Suite which I must say was sensational complete with not just a spa but a sauna, 2 floors of complete luxury. We were amazed at how beautiful the suite was and the views over the city which were fantastic. We had breakfast included in our package which was beautiful, so much to choose from. Having just returned from fabulous holidays in Fiji and New Zealand recently I'm left wondering why I don't spend more time in Sydney. Anyway we had such an amazing stay and can't wait to go back, we will definately next time book a suite. Thanks Star City Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice break”
Reviews.Author: morehu
Reviews.Content: Smooth check in and made to feel welcome by Lauren at reception.Room was spacious due to the only king size bed room avaliable was a bathroom with handicap facilities and no bath in it , but that was no problem twin bed room was available but spouse and I were on a getaway deal and that wasnt the idea of a getaway to be in twin beds! Room drab uninviting colours but very clean and nice tiles in bathroom.Astral restaurant has awesome views and it was a pleasure to have a yummy breakfast and take in beautiful views on a gorgeuos morning to finish off our stay at star city, a swim in the pool before leaving should also be on the books great pool with lovely views ,on the whole I would tell friends to stay here great location monorail right there to get around.

Reviews.Title: “The Ryanair of hotels - check your bill extremely carefully”
Reviews.Author: MrBok
Reviews.Content: Arrived early Sunday morning off the flight at 7.30 a.m. - over 10 of us. No rooms available but we were on the priority list - must have been no. 10,000 on it as I did not get my room until 3.30 p.m. At least it had a harbour view. Rooms and corridors drab brown colours and lifts take a long time to come. It is a depressing place. The pairs of underwear disappeared en-route from my room to the laundry although that was settled at $A20. The bill was an elaboate work of fiction for charges that should not have been there such as a colleague used the valet paring one night so they charged it every night based on 'we always add that to the bill' and even though my name was ticked off every breakfast they charged on the days I did not have it because 'we do not communicate with the restaurant'. I realise the place is a casino but should the hotel ill be a lottery? And why did a stay there - because of my colleagues who love the pool - which was being rebuilt when we arrived - great!

Reviews.Title: “Refurb”
Reviews.Author: Zammit
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again at leats 3 times in the last 2 months. Very impressed with standard of room compared to pre refurb. Rooms have flat screens with plenty of chanels and nice spacious bed/desk area and nice sized bathrooms. Staff at the hotel are very freindly from the Valet to Room Service. Be careful when booking as the best rates and deals are almost always found on their own website www.starcity.com.au I would stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: peanuttoe
Reviews.Content: An even better hotel tha the one we stayed at Cairns. More Classy although both are casino hotel. A liitle hiccup during check-in but the rest was smooth. The conceirge was very helpful in giving directions and comments, only bad point is that the bell boy doesn't look too keen to help with the luggage. Do note that the buffet dinner at breakfast area is almost packed every night and the one Chinese Restaurant serves really really good cuisine. Overall a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice a comfortable stay, after one minor issue”
Reviews.Author: soo_what
Reviews.Content: Stayed at star city in late June for 3 nights in a two bedroom apartment. On arriving were given a room on a lower level which had no views at all after booking a city skyline view was disappointing and then the sounds and vibrations kicked in from the construction site right outside the balcony. Returned to recepition to see if anything could be done about the noise, after half an hour or so we were relocated to the 10th floor which was a wonderful room, views from the balcony of city skyline with harbour bridge and luna park in the distance, and a nice view over darling harbour. Staff very friendly nothing was to much trouble,housekeeping daily. Room service a bit on the expensive side but good food.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT DEAL - REALLY NICE - but beware”
Reviews.Author: Ciao68
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 2 bedroom apartments for 4 days with 2 teenage children. The rooms were fantastic, extremely spacious 2 single beds (1room) and bathroom and king size bed with ensuite with huge walk in robes. Extremely clean and serviced daily. Darling Harbour spectacular views. Our package included 4 buffet breakfast which were fantastic $399 ($499 sat) received 10% off being an entertainment book member. Would definitely stay here again, but be aware that there is construction starting whereby the bulldozers started making lots noise by 7am and throughout the day, not sure if you can request a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start but great in the end”
Reviews.Author: Carole53
