Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 2 nights in June after my initial shock - called at 10am to see if I could get in early to be told the whole complex was closed until 3.30 and no I could not leave my baggage then after another call and spoke to another staff member yes complex closed but I could leave my baggage, we had a great stay the room was great and staff very helpful. There was so much to do in "Star City" on the rainy day we didn't even leave, had breakfast saw a great show then dinner would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: lellijay
Reviews.Content: Ok.... when we booked, (had a very very good price with Lastminute.com which included the Sunday night stay for just $10 if we stopped Friday and Saturday which we did). Anyway, before we arrived, my husband telephoned ahead and advised that it was our anniversary and could we guarantee either the best room in its class or to upgrade (at a cost if necessary). He was advised, Yes, and that they would also ensure something sent up to the room! (they sent up "Champagne" (obviously not Moet but a Pinot Noir - still nevertheless not bad!)). We arrived at the hotel approx 2 hours before we intended and my husband left me downstairs to wander around while he sorted out the room - the room he was given looked onto a wonderful red brick wall! (Not quite what we had in mind!) Could we upgrade - Yes, for $100 dollars. Ok, not what we had in mind either, but anything had to be better than what we'd originally been given! For the $100 we got an upgrade to room 1121 - which is one of the Star Suites - I cannot describe the room without getting all giddy! I have stopped in some really good hotels in my time, but this was the best room ever! It had leather settee in the living area, and a 4 place table in dining area, plasma tvs throughout - ie in living area, bedroom and in the wall above the bath! A king size bed with a pillow menu!?!?! Absolutely awesome! The kiddies have never had so many baths in the space of 3 days before! Not an expense we intended spending because it does cost quite a lot to stay at this hotel in the first place, but it was so worth it! The staff are wonderful, even if a little forgetful at times - we upgraded to breakfast at the Astral, which compared to the Garden buffet really wasn't worth the extra $10 dollars as there wasn't as much choice, even though you do get items on a little a la carte menu that are cooked to order, and fully included in the upgrade. However, were a little disappointed when we looked at the bill to find that they'd charged us $100 dollars instead of just $30, but they did deduct the who $100 off the bill at the end of the stay! Also, I unfortunately rolled my ankle on a pavement nr to harbourside shopping centre and when my husband telephoned reception on our return, apart from asking if we needed any assistance from a doctor advised where to get bandages from and also promptly brought us up an ice bucket and extra towels to try and get the swelling down. (However I did try to get another bucket of ice on the Saturday night, and was advised that it was a $5 dollar cost!?!?!?!) The Astral restaurant is a lot easier to access than the Garden Buffet,. because you have to either go through to the far end of the casino or (as we did because we had the children with us) you have to go to the lobby, walk about 100 metres, and then try and find the right escalator to get back up to the Buffet! There's a lot more choice there though, even though probably not as posh - (I saw someone thrust a $20 into the waitress's hand before they'd even sat down - bit pretentious I think). The sports club is brilliant - there is a pool that is half in, and half out of the hotel, and there is a spa tub outside (which we used when it was raining - was very very warm) as well as one in the inside part. We didn't use the gym, but it looked pretty well stocked. The views from the pool area were fabulous, as they were from our room! One problem that we did think needed addressing by the hotel is that you cannot gain access directly to the hotel from the front of the casino, which meant you had to walk all the way round the back to the lobby or go through the casino (which we couldn't with the children). All in all, we had a fabulous stay at Star City, and the only problem for us now would be staying there again if we didn't get the upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globalisation
Reviews.Content: One of the biggest hotels i have ever been to. Very good location and lot of things available under its roof. Good food and a good casino. Normal rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: Kiffs68
Reviews.Content: I have to say up front that we booked a standard room but were upgraded to a suite so can't comment on the standard rooms, but the suite was superb. I've never stayed in such a large, well stocked, clean, great view hotel room before. It was excellent, a large longe/kitchen area witha toilet (the size of some bathrooms I've had in the past). The bedroom was huge and the Bathroom proper was to die for, Just look at the pictures of the room on their website and they don't do it justice. The rooms are way better than te pictures (Manager-please get better pictures as your rooms are better than they look on-line). we stayed there as we wanted a night at the casino, it as much fun watching the high rollers play as playing yourself, but don't miss out on a few flutters, it adds to the experience. Then the location is perfect, a few minutes to Darling Harbour and the fantastic range of restaurants along the quay the another few minutes to the rest of Sydney, perfect if you don't want to traipse around for hours. The standard room we originally booked was a little expensive but the upgrade was great. we did look t the prices for the suites.... out of our usual range, but for an excellent treat I'd do it again for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1st visit to Sydney - we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Bfours
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (parents, 23 yr and 16 yr old) stayed for 6 days over Easter. We enjoyed our stay at Star City - arrived about 9am and were able to immediately go to our 2 bedroom apartment. Apartment was nice, rooms good size and bathrooms large. Nice to have the washer/dryer available - even included soap powder! Our package included breakfast and we all enjoyed the buffet which had something for everyone. Rooms were serviced daily. Only problem we had was getting the balcony door open - it was quite a performance each time, as the "suction" on it was huge and took alot of strength to open it. We enjoyed the location - very close to Darling Harbour with it's great choice of restaurants and it wasn't far to walk to middle of town (QVB, etc). Lovely area around the hotel. We ate one night at the Italian restaurant in the hotel complex and pizza's there are great! Also has Subway, ice cream bar, Irish bar, hamburger cafe available, besides the hotel restaurants. We enjoyed the ferries, buses, light rail system - went to the Easter show, Bondi, Manly, Parramatta and system is easy to travel on. Walked all over the main centre, Circular Quay, over the Harbour Bridge, the Rocks, Darling Harbour areas. Got a late checkout of 3pm on last day of our stay and it was well worth it as we could relax right until we had to catch taxi to the airport. Only disappointment was the pool - didn't get sun in the afternoon, but was still nice and view was great over to the bridge. We will definitely come back to Sydney, and would definitely stay at Star City and recommend it to anyone (especially if you can get a package deal).

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: yippekaya
Reviews.Content: Got the Metro Light Rail train from Central station to Star City, but found it difficult to locate the hotel check in after getting off the train. All the signs seem to be geared towards directing you to the casino. Eventually found the check in after wandering about for a few minutes, then had to wait about 5 minutes in the check in queue. I stayed in a a deluxe Pyrmont view room and to be honest the view wasn't very exciting - the harbour view would have been far better, but I think it was quite a bit more expensive. There is a 7-eleven type shop, plenty of restaurants, a subway and bars within the complex so there is plenty of choice to choose from. The MTR is very convenient if you want to travel to city centre and 2 different bus tour companies pass outside the Star City complex. I don't have anything really negative to say about the hotel, but on the other hand there is nothing special to say.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 Star Hotel masquerades as 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: captaingary
Reviews.Content: Touted as a 5 star "LUXURY" hotel (even on the tour buses), it is actually a 3 star average hotel. The marble in the bath is so old and dated it is dull and flaking. We stayed 4 nights. Grounds & Fountains around the hotel are rather shabby. If you are a non-smoker, be prepared to smell smoke all through the promenade. "No smoking" signs are clearly posted but are mostly ignored with no enforcement evident. Avoid the hotel "mid-priced" restaurants and head for Darling Harbour or the Fish Market whch are close walking distance. Avoid all restaurants and buffets inside the Casino!

Reviews.Title: “Indescribable!!! Upgraded to the most beautiful room we've seen!”
Reviews.Author: paul_annette_26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the australia day long weekend (and our one year anniversary). We booked a deluxe harbour view room cost about 250 for one night. we arrived and were upgraded to the star suite. We thought we were very fortunate however did not realise what we were in for. From the moment we walked down the hallway to the black door leading to our apartment... I will let anyone who hasn't stayed there experience it for themselves. this apartment cannot be described. nor can you find photos of it on the internet. you will be mesmerized. it is unbelievable. the best hotel room we have ever stayed in. Now we cannot find a hotel room that can top that. unforntunately if you were to book the room yourself it costs approx 750 per night however if you are as lucky as us you may just be upgraded.... it is awesome! we also stayed in the standard room on other occasions however once staying in the "star room" it is like comparing it to a formula 1. p.s eat at the lotus pond (chinese restaurant) one of the best chinese restaurants in sydney

Reviews.Title: “Smashing Location”
Reviews.Author: Chris_n_Jude
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in the apartments of Star City. The ability to cater occassionally and use the washing machine meant that we could deal so much easier when travelling for the period of time that we were. Location is great for Darling Harbour and its not too far from Central station for access anywhere e.g. Circular Quay. Only gripe would be that the pool is not big enough for the size of the hotel but excellent overall.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect apartment”
Reviews.Author: aki_q
Reviews.Content: We had 3bed rooms apartment in Star City on 9th floor. The room was very clean, large and modem, and the view is great, we can see the harbour bridge from each room. The service was good.highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: karos1
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say, from the moment we arrived it was perfect!!!! The Valet staff helped take the luggage from the car and straight up to our room. The reception staff were very helpful and very polite and I must make a special mention and thank you to Patrick and not forgetting Aaron on Concierge who helped me make my mums birthday extra special. We headed up to the room and wow, what a view!!!!! We were on the 11th floor in room 1123 and the view over harbour bridge and Darling Harbour were to die for. The room was spotless and had everything we could have needed and more. The hotel itself, well, it took us 4 days to find our way around, every day we discovered a different area, bar or shops. We dined in the food court the first day as we felt quite tired after our journey, the food was delicious not what you expect from a food court but from a top restaurant. We also dined in the Garden Buffet for dinner on 2 occasions at a cost of $28 for an all you can eat buffet with seafood. We also had buffet breakfast every morning which was included in our package again there was everything you could want and they catered for everyone. I would recommend to people to become a member as soon as you arrive this can be done on the casino floor and provides you with discounts at the restaurant and food court and also the hotel shop. We will definately be back but at $345 a night (inc breakfast, valet parking, Harbour Bridge View) we will have to save up a little first.

Reviews.Title: “Top quality apartments in great location”
Reviews.Author: perfectlyperth
Reviews.Content: On many previous visits I have stayed at Star City Hotel because of the proximity to the Lyric Theatre. As there were two of us this time we decided to stay in the Apartments instead. We chose a two bedroom, two bathroom apartment with a Pyrmont View. (Its been a couple of months so I have forgotten the room number but from memory we were on floor 15 or 16). I cannot exagerate how big this apartment was. Its bigger than the one I live in. The living area had ample seating, a desk with internet access and a LCD TV. Great sized balcony too which looked out over the rest of Star City, pool areas, and Anzac Bridge. The kitchen was full sized and stocked with all necessary crockery, cutlery and kitchenwares. Toaster, kettle, coffee plunger, mircrowave and full sized fridge. Oven & dishwasher. Housekeeping restocked tea, coffee & sugar etc each day. There was also handy stocked salt & pepper shakers. The main bedroom huge with a king sized bed, walk through mirrored closets stocked with extra pillows and blankets, huge bathroom with a full sized bath, big shower, toilet and long vanity. Hair dryer located in a drawer. Shampoos and conditioners and bath/shower gels were nice quality. Towels and faceclothes etc were plentiful and very thick and plush. Bedroom also contained a good sized LCD tv and desk with net connection. The second bedroom was a queen sized bed with 2 wardrobes and a desk with net connection. The second bathroom was across the way and was spacious with large shower, vanity and toilet, plus washing machine and dryer, ironing board and iron. Housekeeping were great and restocked the room daily and did the dishes. Rooms were immaculately clean. Ducted air con was good - maybe a little too good. It got a little chilly some nights. Noisewise we could hear nothing in the corridors and no external noise at all. Lovely and peaceful. Lifts were extremely fast. We stayed for a week and shopped at the nearby Coles (a 3 minute stroll away) for groceries.

Reviews.Title: “Great Serviced Apartment”
Reviews.Author: wsantoso
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 2br serviced apartment at Star City for a weekend trip and were very happy with it. Convenient location, big spacious apartment, and very clean. Highly recommended for Sydney visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Annie137
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, great facilities and good all round hotel. Expected the Casino to be a little more 'Vegas' and felt it was a little flat.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price if you're watching a show”
Reviews.Author: Rambutaan
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to stay at the Star City Hotel since we were watching the Phantom of the Opera the same night at the Lyric Theatre (which is part of the same complex). We paid quite a bit for one night but we figured since the price included (1) accommodation, (2) parking (which is expensive in Sydney), (3) free breakfast and (4) the convenience of just going downstairs to watch the show. Best of all, we got upgraded to a very spacious apartment suite when we arrived - the curtains are even automatically controlled by switches (which was a bit of a novelty for us)! The only real problem I had with the place was trying to find it! It ended up being a very expensive trip after I inadvertently when through several tollways without even knowing it :(. But that's not a real criticism of the hotel, more Sydney itself (if you aren't a local).

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: emo119
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a great time. The rooms are exceptionally quiet given the vicinity to the casino... we never heard a thing! Very clean rooms. Staff Very helpful. Close to the harbour and transport links. Swimming pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: MustangMandy
Reviews.Content: Okay, the Star City is a really nice and very well maintained hotel. The beds are very comfy, huge bathrooms and very nice facilities! The pool and hot tub are on the rooftop and very nice, but not open late enough. We only tried the food court and none of the restaurants (they were a little pricey) and it was okay, but we like eating where the locals do. Check-in and out were a breeze and the bell desk was excellent for info! It's located on Darling Harbour, which is a nice area. You can walk to most places if you're up to it, or take the public transportation, which is all right there. The casino was okay...it's no Vegas, that's for sure, but it's okay. We got our room at a heavily discounted rate from Skyauction.com, so it was definitely worth it for us, but I'm not sure I would pay the $200 a night it normally goes for. Overall it is a really nice hotel, very clean and very nice amenities with a pretty good location, if you can find a good deal or willing to pay the money for it.

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed in better 3 star hotels”
Reviews.Author: TheEloquentOne
Reviews.Content: Upon being "upgraded" to an apartment, we were horrified to be stepping into a smoky non-smoking room. The decor was far from impressive, especially the cheap and tacky bits of chipboard passing for a bathroom cabinet. The robotic hotel reception staff seemed quite unplussed at my dissatisifaction, when I raised the above. The breakfast experience, at the Garden Buffet, was more like attending a food court than a 5 star dining room. Upon arrival the queue to get a table was more like attending the local club (RSL, pokies venue). While the choice of food was impressive and well displayed (and tasty), the sight of bus-boy trolleys clearing tables reminded me of the food court at the local Westfield shopping centre. Plus queuing for the egg station to have an omelete made would have been a novel experience if I could have been bothered. In future, we will be returning to the Wentworth, were the experience is truly 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “Suite Life”
Reviews.Author: Ozzietraveller08
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a new star suite at Star City. These are the rooms that have just been released and they are spectacular. The decor is really upmarket and the first thing you notice on entering teh room is the fantastic views and the big LCD TV. The bedroom is even bigger with a massive spa and tv so you can kick back and watch your favourite show in the tub - which of course we did after ordering some room service - Bliss! The hotel is situated right next to Darling Harbour and a short walf to the CBD - but it really comes to light at night with the Casino, theatres, restaurants and my favourite 36 degree cocktail bar. We had dinner in ASTRAL, it was excellent, although a little on the expensive side - worth it though if you are celebrating. Overall a great stay, if you stay in the suite, bring an Ipod, connect it up to the stereo - easy, and set the mood with the mood light in the bedroom - choose a colour!

Reviews.Title: “10 STARS for STAR City Hotel and Casino!!!”
Reviews.Author: MIZSUPREME
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded expectations in every way possible. First off, the 2 Bedroom Suite was spotless clean as well as welcoming and comfortable. The location of the property is very close to attractions and public transportation. It was very tourist friendly as I was a first-time Sydney visitor. In addition, the restaurants and entertainment at the property were excellent. It ranged from low budget Subway to high end fine dining. The casino was also a ++++++++++!!! I would most defnitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: matildab
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Star city after reading reviews and trying to find a 2 bedroom apartment close to the city.,that was resonably priced. We booked direct on there website and got a good deal 275.00 anight. The apartments are part of the casino and hotel complex. There is a little shop in the lobby or a supermarket Coles around the corner. This place is located on the tram line into town which also connects with the monorail at Chinatown. Darling harbour is only minutes away and is full of tousist attractions and restaurants open till late. There is also a ferry stop that will bring you to Circular Quay and the Opera House. Darling harbour at night is so pretty worth staying there just to walk by there at night. Now the apartment, it was new clean modern had two tv;'s 2 bathrooms,washer dryer,dishwasher,kitcher. Our view we were on the 5th floor was of the harbour bridge and lovely but you should stay on a higher floor to get the better view.Try to visit the heater pool at night view is stunning you can have a champagne(plastic glass) and take in the view breathtaking.Would definately recomend this place. It has the tram,ferry and monorail all on it's doorstep.Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities - but keep your eye out for reduced rates”
Reviews.Author: brisbane21
Reviews.Content: Star City has 24/7 convenience thanks to the adjoining casino, but the rooms themselves are a little tired. That said, they're still well equipped - the 2 bedroom unit we stayed in had everything we needed, except for the absolute lack of patio furniture. Beds were clean and comfy, and the lounge room was roomy. The hotel is starting to show its age though, and the standard prices are several times what they should be. If you want to stay somewhere nice and central (and open around the clock), check out local hotel websites in advance and you should be able to score a room here at half the price or less.

Reviews.Title: “Not a relaxing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Benalmadena01
Reviews.Content: Using their hotel internet site I directly booked a Harbour Bridge view (Floor Level 10-16). The initial booking was for 4 nights but our Air New Zealand flight was cancelled. I rang them to tell them we would be a day late which was no problem - no penalty charge. On arrival we were assigned a King Size bed on the 10th floor. The bedroom and view were lovely but unfortunately at a quarter past eight in the morning renovation work on a room nearby meant that it was impossible to relax. A receptionist explained that the workers weren't supposed to start before 9 in the morning. Even so I requested a change of room and we were assigned a room on the 16th floor with 2 double beds. A porter moved our suitcases and gave us programmed entry cards for the new room. The renovation work was still quite noisy on the 16th floor but not as bad. The view had improved though and Sydney Harbour Bridge could now be clearly seen (without a nearby construction crane obscuring it). When we went back to our hotel room in the afternoon for a siesta once again there was drilling including a hammer drill and sometimes two drills at once - quite a din! The only remedy was to listen to music on a radio. The following morning the drilling started well before 9 o'clock again. The third morning we had to be up early to get the A380 morning flight to Singapore so at least we missed the drilling noise. I don't regret staying in this hotel but I wouldn't recommend it until the renovation work is complete.

Reviews.Title: “A faded star”
Reviews.Author: Irish_Jet_Set
Reviews.Content: I was here last year, and returned because it was convenient to be staying here at this location in Sydney. I was assigned a room on the 9th floor, and was very disappointed with the state of the room, tired and grotty. stained carpets, scratched desks/furniture, chipped bath, not really 5* in any way. Expensive too, in fact twice what I paid for my fantastic experience across the Tasman in Sky City! There are plenty of other newer and smarter experiences within minutes of this place, don't make any special effort to book this place unless you find out his has been renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Trudie
Reviews.Content: The four of us shared a 2 bed apartment and it was above expectations. The staff were all without exception friendly, polite and smiley. The apartment had a great kitchen with full oven/hob, dishwasher (with dishwashing tablets) and all the required cookery utensils etc. We had a washer and dryer in its only mini laundry area with iron and ironing board. Large dining table, comfy lounge area and a large balcony with nice views. Each bedroom had its own bath/shower room and there were plasma screens in the lounge and the main bedroom. Easy to walk to Darling harbour and you can get the ferry at Pyremont Pier just over the road really...fantastic positiony. The pool area was quiet and luxurious. The complex is there is you want it...we all enjoyed wandering around the casino and bars/restaurant areas, but if that is not your scene you don't really have to go near them. There is a supermarket round the corner (ask reception where as it is in a hidden mall area) and a bottle shop nearby. Overall I give this 5 stars easily, well worth the money...we got a great deal on their site.

Reviews.Title: “Entertainment overload”
Reviews.Author: Blossom55
Reviews.Content: With family members from the UK, we stayed at the hotel, as opposed to the apartments, for three nights from 27/2/08. From check-in, throughout stay, to checkout, all staff members encountered were pleasant, couteous, efficient and helpful. This attribute, I believe is one of the best aspects of the hotel. The rooms were relatively well maintained, sufficiently well appointed in the room itself and the bathroom. The deficiencies were quickly remedied. For instance, the mirror in the entry area of the room could have been cleaner and on one particular day we found that tea bags were not replenished. Apart from this the service aspect was fine. When requested, teabags were brought to the room within minutes. The view from our room overlooked Darling Harbour and to the left we could see the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The booking was made, on the hotel's website, utilising their special offers tab. The accommodation offered for the price, which included breakfast for two, was considered to be good value for the area. On a personal level, I did not like the 'busyness' of the place but it was certainly a good location for elderly family members who found they had a lot of options to choose from and very little distance to travel within the building to see that their needs were met. After all it is a casino and entertainment complex, though not to my taste, to those it suits this hotel would be a good option. Though breakfast was part of the package, our bill did contain a charge for breakfast, which when pointed out to reception staff, was quickly rectified. Though I would not choose to stay here again, my family certainly will be and would recommend both the property and location for first time visitors to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fun times at Star City”
Reviews.Author: thriller_7
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight at Star City in a superior Pyrmont view room. The room was a good size, with a very comfy couch and modern furnishings. The view was not great, but that was to be expected. There was one hiccup when we checked in at about 4pm, and were assigned a room which we discovered was had not been cleaned! The staff apologised profusely and sent a bottle of pink champagne to our room, which was a very nice touch. We had a fantastic dinner at Pyrmont Steak and Seafood restaurant, and enjoyed having the excitement of the casino on site and all the entertainment options it offered. The Lagoon Bar in the casino has an enormous waterfall and drinks are much cheaper here than in the Lobby Bar. I'll definitely return to Star City but next time I'll stay longer so that I can try more restaurants or see a show at the Lyric Theatre. One word of warning: convenience store is crazily expensive. I bought a toothbrush that had thai writing all over it for $8.00 I was prepared for a huge markup, but that's impressive! Nothing is priced and I'm sure that if they were, no-one would buy anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Apartment”
Reviews.Author: Schlanger
Reviews.Content: we booked an apartment...............wow complete with 2 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, Lounge come dinning room, full kitchen and washer / tumble dryer..............great value SÃ©an F

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Andy M
Reviews.Content: Stayed seven nights from New years day, we picked Star City as it was close to Darling Harbour. The downside first, they had no apartments available and we were placed in a Deluxe Room, very Nice but the Sheraton in Noosa was better. Considering the money we were paying the room could have been nicer and the view was not good (so beware). The good points, we ate at Fortunes which was Breakfast Buffet this was in with the price of the Room, Buffet was excellent with a lot of choice, although senior staff attempted to try and rush you if it was close to closing (10.30am). We also ate at Pyrmonts this is a excellant location and wonderful food I highly recommend the Seafood platter for two . We also used Astral Bar on the roof, which is a excellant way to start or end your evening, inside or out you will have a gorgeous view of Darling Harbour,CBD and the Bridge. We visited the Casino (not my scene) but for those who enjoy a flutter there cannot be better in Oz and we enjoyed having a drink in one of the bars and just people watched, the casino seemed busy 24/7. There are a number of bars and eateries you can use (Harbour Walk) including, Subway, Score Bar, Irish Bar, Ice Cream Parlour,Pizza restaurant, situated here is the convenience store which had about everything and always open. The Hotel Coffee Lounge is quiet and well stocked with Cakes etc. We used the pool, the location is a bonus with good views of Sydney whilst you relax, the gym situated here is also very good. The location of the Resort (thats what it is) is about 3-4 minute walk from the Maritime Musum, which is the start of Darling Harbour and all the attractions. I would have given Star City the five, but there were little things that stopped me doing so, however if you go you will enjoy your stay I would recommend the apartments and not the deluxe rooms

Reviews.Title: “A Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EveElizHelen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the beginning of October, 2007 and it was fabulous. The hotel was like a mini city, the rooms were lovely and the whole experience is one i would advise anyone to try. I would definately return to stay here should I be lucky enough to go back to Oz.

Reviews.Title: “Large 4* Apartment”
Reviews.Author: ade637
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good quality,clean and modern apartment stay here.Close walk to Darling Harbour for good restaurants and Aquarium. Also ferry stop here gives easy and cheap access to Circular Harbour. The city centre is an enjoyable and short walk from Star City.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue”
Reviews.Author: janislynn
Reviews.Content: It is what it is i.e. a Casino Hotel! That said we stayed in a three bedroom apartment on the ninth floor (952) that had fantastic views of Darling Harbour and the Sydney Harbour Bridge - all which looked spectular - especially at night. Darling Harbour with its bars and restaurants is only minutes away. Yoy can walk to Circular Quay via Market Street and George Street in about 30 minutes or alternatively you can catch a ferry (with five stops) from Darling Quay. Our room had all the facilities to support our stay. The convenience store open 247 is good but a little pricey. The food mall ranges from a Subway to an Italian style bistro and there is also fast food and more in the casino. We are not casino types but it is well worth going if only people watch and enter the free daily draw ... you need to register for a casino card (which is free). My wife won a $10 voucher which she converted to $100 with a lucky win on the roulette table. Our one and only gamble! Also it is worth going to Chinatown via Darling Harbour Gardens. It takes about 20 mins to walk there and the food is cheap compared to the harbourside restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great service & rooms”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_FlyerSydney
Reviews.Content: Booked for 2 adults and one child. The beds were big and comfortable, with tea / coffee facilities. The bathroom was a decent size with large towels. The pool was rather unique. Part of it was undercover and the other half open air. It was supposedly heated but felt relatively cool. There was a children's pool that was really warm and steaming. Towels were supplied at the pool. The buffet breakfast (included in the package) was quite substantial and delicious. We could have upgraded and had it at the Astral for a few dollars more but was happy with the selection. They had a hot and cold selection and simple Chinese treats (dumplings, egg tarts, rice porridge). The staff at the breakfast place was extremely polite and friendly. The front desk was a bit inconsistent. My husband and child checked in around noon and was told to wait as the room was not ready. Fair enough as check in was 2:00 pm which is standard They were told they would be called as soon as possible. When I arrived at 3:30, I was surprised to see them waiting in the lobby with no information whatsoever. I approached the front desk and was given a key immediately - so the room must have been ready. There were no apologies. However at other times the front desk service was excellent. On the whole, the experience was rather nice. Although we live in the city, it was still pleasant t discover the Pyrmont side of town.

Reviews.Title: “An extensively huge property...”
Reviews.Author: Vikkyonline
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Star City during our 4 day stay at Sydney. It was a wonderful stay in a huge property comprising of casino, and other entertainment media. The following were certain highlights of the property : 1. It is almost a 5 minutes walk from the Darling Habour if you take an inner route through the Museam. You might not require a taxi service incase you take a ferry from circular quay to darling harbour. 2. It has bus and a train terminal located at the basement which makes an easier access just a minutes away. 3. The property is really big and the gilmpses show that you are in a 5 star deluxe hotel even if you are not being charged for the same. 4. The hotel has a full facility huge sized spa with major facilities. overlooking the harbur. 5. Upon arrival we were offered a harbour view room which gave wonderful and harbour and city view rooms. Especially in the evening it offered major glimpses f the ligths failling over the harbour. 6. The bufffet offerings were extensive. 7. The coienserge staff was extraordinary helpful in getting the information in the best possible way when being asked for. 8. The room was fully equipped and the bathroom was also full of all the aminities. 9. The room service was also great. Inspite of all of the above, there were certain points which brought a little dent t this 5 Star looking hotel : 1. The property is connected to a Food court and a mall including casino around which gives an access to the general public in the area. This reduces the privacy when you are sitting at the lobby with the general people walking in. 2. The reception staff needs some better lessons on being a little soft to their guests requests as in case of other 5 star hotels. We were refused a late check-out inspite of our repeated requests. Their attitude most of the time was highly impersonal. 3. The staff at the SPA was also not very friendly and was serving as if they were doing a favour. 4. There is a constructon of a new tower happening at the side of the hotel so pl check the room which should not e facing the construction site 5. 20AUD were deposited while chcking into the room. Inspite of the above weak points looking at the 5 starish looks and the relatively lower rates i would recommend the stay here moreso considering the closer view to the darling harbour. Check this out !!!

Reviews.Title: “Views to die for”
Reviews.Author: espgirl
Reviews.Content: At first we were put on the 5th floor (smoking) with two double beds, which was a very nice room but with 2 adults and a child it didn't leave much room for the cot etc. so we called reception and they had us moved straight away. We were moved to the 8th floor, huge king sized bed and the views are indescribable, breathtaking, amazing!!! Fabulous bathroom except had trouble keeping the water in the shower (could have been because we had a toddler trying to splash everything in sight) great pool area, didn't see the gym, we had the buffet the first night but enless you are a HUGE eater I think it is poor value for money. Had buffet breakfast included and that was lovely. Also won a bit of money at the casino, so all up I think it was a fantastic stay!!

Reviews.Title: “FUN”
Reviews.Author: satcgal
Reviews.Content: Star City Hotel is GREAT!! Excellent location, great bars and pubs and resurants. Close walk to Darling Harbour. Great experience. Oh and dont forget the CASINO..When you stay in Sydney, you gotta check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Big and Brash - But we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: VMJEastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Star City for six nights, having been recommended the aparttments by some friends. It's a huge entertainment complex close to Darling Harbour. We arrived very early (around 6am in the morning) but despite this unearthly hour the reception desk were very helpful and checked us into our apartment straightaway. Even if this hadn't been possible we could have used the pool and leisure complex to get freshened up after our long flight. We were staying at the apartments with our three daughters, aged 8, 14 and 16 and there was loads of space. We had two bedrooms and two bathrooms with a bed settee in the living area. The kitchen was really really well equipped with everything we could possibly have needed - and all the utensils and cooker, hob, fridge freezer etc looked brand new. The swimming pool was a slight disappointment in that it was quite small and very cold! However, we were so busy that we didn't need to use it more than once anyway! We couldn't have been more pleased with the apartment itself - although it wasn't especially cheap. I think we paid around Â£1250 for 6 nights. Although it felt slightly out on a limb - transport links to the hotel were fantastic. It was a five minute walk to Darling harbour - where there are scores of restaurants, bars, shops and attractions and of course ferries to Circular Quay... Although we were aware of the casino when we came downstairs we were never bothered by any noise from this or any of the many bars and restaurants in the complex itself. If you're expecting beautiful views of Sydney's amazing harbourside you'll have to pay a premium. And if you're wanting cosy and personal service - forget it! But this was just what we as a family of five needed. And we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “More than just a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ll5x
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Star City in April 07 for 5 nights and we all agreed it was awesome! We had two deluxe double rooms which were exactly what you would expect from this class of hotel: very spacious, extremely comfortable beds and contemporary decor. The concierge were extremely friendly and helpful in all occasions we needed to use a taxi. The hotel itself was immense yet luxurious. It has a casino, many restaurants (a few of which are buffet based), shops, theatre, pubs and leisure centre (pool and gym). The location was brilliant - very close to Darling harbour and short taxi ride to the city centre. This hotel was an absolutely excellent start to our holiday in Australia and we thoroughly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all bad”
Reviews.Author: Scott_and_Amanda
Reviews.Content: The Star City is a huge hotel, comprising shops, restaurants, a casino and a theatre. It is very well located in Darling Harbour, which it itself handy for everywhere and great for bars/ restaurants etc. We stayed in an apartment which was large and comfortable. This place came very close to a 4 star review and I should note my husband thinks it should get one. I have however marked it down for the following reasons: 1. We paid extra for a view over the harbour. This is really not worth it, its just a view of high rises and in our case, a construction site directly outside our room. 2. There was a lot of construction work, which caused noise often quite early in the morning 3. The only way to get to the pool due to the construction work was to get a lift down 9 floors, walk across the hotel lobby to another lift and go up 5 floors 4. Most of the gym was shut for construction 5. On the first day of our stay, we attempted to to to the 2 bars recommended by the guide book ( 38o and the one on the top floor) to be told neither opened on Mondays. 6. The mini bar was laughably expensive, more so than I have seen anywhere else Should the hotel not have been undergoing construction, it would have got a 4 start review as it was otherwise good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartments”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSakhalin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the 2 bedroom apartments in March this year. We arrived early so we had to hang around for a while but they did call my internatioal mobile when the room was ready and we could use the pool and spa whilst we waited. The room was excellent. We did not have the view over the harbor but what we had was fine. The room was very clean and every day the maid but the dirty stuff in the dishwasher and turned it on! Location was second to non with 1 5 minute stroll to Darling Harbor with its attractions, resturants and the like. There is a Coles less than 5 minutes walk that is open late. The small shop at the hotel is expensive buy has the basics. The massive spa was good and we sat in there overlooking the bridge at night. Can't say anthing about the casino as we did not go (had young kids). We would go back if we went back to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: rup16
Reviews.Content: star city hotel is waliking distance from sydney harbour,it has a casinoalso. due to this one gets a glimpse of sydneys local jetsetwitout making efforts ,also the sea world is walking distance from the hotel.the hotel is very attractive as the interiors are colourful and theres always a happening air about the place we had breakfast whhich was included in our booking.the spread was excellent, they covered the tastes of different races.the hotel is very well organised, they have bus pick ups for the various excursions one can take to nearby spots blue mountains being one of them .the rooms our very nice and comfy in fact very nice, this hotel is very tourist friendly. we were there for 4 days with 2 kids and would certainly like to go there again

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: peternwalker
Reviews.Content: Chose Star City on the basis of Trip Advisor reviews, with concerns about staying at a Casino and that the location might not be the best. Neednâ€™t have worried. Location, while not city centre, was great. A 3 minute stroll from the Pyrmont Bay ferry point to Circular Quay (Â½-hourly service), 5 minutes walk to Darling Harbour. The casino is entirely separate from the hotel, the whole development being of the â€˜mallâ€™ type with all levels of eateries (smart restaurants to Subway sandwich bar). Accomodation was superb (Pyrmont view de-luxe room) â€“ large room, quiet, great aircon, comfortable beds and immaculate bathroom. Arriving from the UK at 09:00 on a Sunday morning staff were very helpful and friendly, arranging an early check-in. Good outdoor pool and exercise facilities. Only ate in the Fortunes restaurant, the buffet being plentiful and appealing.

Reviews.Title: “Only okay, too much waiting!”
Reviews.Author: Jerax
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at this hotel, and after a few days, we wanted to change hotels. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were told our room was not ready and that they would give us a call as soon as the room actually was ready. Hours passed, still no call. We came back, and they told us the room was ready, but they offered no apology for not calling. To irritate us further, our room came with free buffet breakfast vouchers, which they refused to honour because it 'wasn't in their documentation' even though it was clearly stated while booking online on their official website. Their only suggestion was to find some proof online and show it to them, but they would not cover the expensive internet charges there for doing so. As for the Deluxe Pyrmont View room, it was generally modern and okay. However, the room didn't have a particularly good view and it was not well lit as the lights were oddly placed around the room. The bathroom had a bath/shower which was not comfortable and the toilet paper was attached to the wall only about 10-20 cm above the floor strangely enough. It is also worth noting that the floor level of the Deluxe room, which was apparently 16, may not have actually been as high as 16. Floors 4, 13 and 14 were simply missing and you could not access them. As for the rest of the 7-day stay there, we found the lifts to be infuriatingly slow to arrive at many times, the concierge gave us incorrect information and room service took over an hour to arrive at about 6 p.m. once. A warning to those staying with people under 18 or slightly above that age, the casino forms a large part of that hotel. If you are under 18, you'll usually have to detour around the casino to get to the other side of the hotel rather than going through it. If you are slightly over 18, you'll constantly have to get your ID checked every time you take a shortcut through the casino. The only particularly good things about the hotel that separated it from any other hotel of the same class was that it has good facilities including a casino, restaurants and theatre. The location was also fairly decent, being located near Darling Harbour and having light rail and bus services beneath it. Overall, however, we would not stay there again, we've stayed at far better hotels in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Kaypee00
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Star City before joining a cruise ship. This is a hotel/casino/theatre complex situated in Darling Harbour and just a short walk from down town Sydney. The accommodation is first class and we had a room with views to kill for across Darling Harbour and up to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The room was spotless and the usual tea/coffee was available. There is a small swimming pool at the rear of the hotel with a nice warm jacuzzi beside it. Staff were very helpful at reception. We arrived before noon and the room wasn't ready but the concierge looked after our cases and phoned us on the mobile phone when we could get access, allowing us to wander the area and get our brearings. The casino is very busy day and night and worth a visit just to watch a lot of folks lose a lot of money!! The open topped bus tour of Sydney has a stop just outside the (back) door of the complex and it is well worth catching this to see the sights. It is a hop on hop service with an all day ticket. Would certainly use this hotel again as a base to explore Sydney if (when) we return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Tapyeno
Reviews.Content: What an exoerience. Stayed for a liong weekend as part of my cousin's 60th birthday party. appartment was out of this world with brilliant views from the balcony. Service excellent!

HotelInfo.Name: Astral Tower & Residences at The Star
HotelInfo.Address: 80 Pyrmont Street | Pyrmont, Sydney, New South Wales 2009, Australia (Formerly Star City)
